message.content: Since $f(x)$ has a vertical asymptote at $x=1$, then $x=1$ must be a root of $x^2+ax+b=0$. This gives us $(x-1)(x^2+ax+b)=x^3+(a-1)x^2+(b-a)x+b=0$. Therefore, $a-1=0$ and $b=0$. Since $f(x)$ also has an asymptote at $x=-2$, $x=-2$ must be the other root of $x^2+ax+b=0$. This means $(-2)^2+a(-2)=0\Rightarrow 4-2a=0\Rightarrow a=2$. Finally, we want $a+b+1=\boxed{3}$.
